intro: Nelitris forsteri, commonly known as the Forster's flax, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the shoreline, where it thrives in full sunlight. Nelitris forsteri produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its adaptability to coastal conditions makes it an important species in coastal vegetation and ecological restoration projects.
